definitions.definition: Arrangement or relationship; layout.
A share of the profits in a business.
A lyrical, narrative poem written in octosyllabic couplets that often deals with tales of adventure and romance.
The direction a rope is twisted.
definitions.example: Worm and parcel with the lay; turn and serve the other way.

definitions.definition: A casual sexual partner.
definitions.example: What was I, just another lay you can toss aside as you go on to your next conquest?

definitions.definition: An act of sexual intercourse.
A plan; a scheme.
(uncountable) the laying of eggs.
definitions.example: The hens are off the lay at present.

definitions.definition: A layer.
To place down in a position of rest, or in a horizontal position.
definitions.example: A shower of rain lays the dust.

definitions.definition: To cause to subside or abate.
To prepare (a plan, project etc.); to set out, establish (a law, principle).
To install certain building materials, laying one thing on top of another.
To produce and deposit an egg.
definitions.example: Did dinosaurs lay their eggs in a nest?

definitions.definition: To bet (that something is or is not the case).
definitions.example: I'll lay that he doesn't turn up on Monday.

definitions.definition: To deposit (a stake) as a wager; to stake; to risk.
To have sex with.
To take a position; to come or go.
definitions.example: to lay forward;  to lay aloft

definitions.definition: To state; to allege.
To point; to aim.
(ropemaking) To put the strands of (a rope, a cable, etc.) in their proper places and twist or unite them.
definitions.example: to lay a cable or rope

definitions.definition: To place and arrange (pages) for a form upon the imposing stone.
To place (new type) properly in the cases.
To apply; to put.
To impose (a burden, punishment, command, tax, etc.).
definitions.example: to lay a tax on land

definitions.definition: To impute; to charge; to allege.
To present or offer.
definitions.example: to lay an indictment in a particular county;   to lay a scheme before one

definitions.definition: A lake.
A ballad or sung poem; a short poem or narrative, usually intended to be sung.
definitions.example: 1805 The Lay of the Last Minstrel, Sir Walter Scott.

definitions.definition: A meadow; a lea.
A law.
An obligation; a vow.
To don or put on (tefillin (phylacteries)).
